title: OpenVMS.Courses.Sys_Net_2.ZIP
description:
Course Title: OpenVMS System and Network Node Management II
EY-T448E-L0

OVERVIEW OF PRODUCT

This course presents managing OpenVMS Systems in a standalone, networked, or OpenVMS Cluster environment.

COURSE ABSTRACT

This course features:

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Managing disks and queues
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Layered products installation
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Monitoring of system resources
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Basic system customization tasks
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Managing LAT services, such as terminal services and remote print queues.

COURSE OUTLINE

UNDERSTANDING SYSTEM RESOURCES
Virtual Memory Management Concepts
Working Sets
Paging and Swapping
Scheduling Resources
Network Configurations
MANAGING BATCH AND PRINT REQUESTS
Managing Queues and Spooled Devices
Controlling Batch and Print Jobs
MANAGING LAT SERVICES
LAT Network Concepts
Using the LAT Control Program
Setting Up a LAT Cluster Alias
Setting Up a Remote Print Queue
MANAGING VOLUMES
Review of OpenVMS Device Concepts
Review of System Directories
Obtaining Information About Volumes
Preparing Volumes for Use
Handling Common Volume Problems
INTRODUCTION TO SYSTEM CUSTOMIZATON
Customizing System Startup Files
Customizing Login Command Procedures
Customizing System Parameters
Maintaining the DECnet for OpenVMS Remote Node Database
INSTALLING LAYERED PRODUCTS
Managing Product Licenses
Installing Layered Products
MONITORING SYSTEM RESOURCES
Using the Show Cluster Utility
Using the Monitor Utility
Monitoring with DCL Commands
Monitoring the Network with NCP Commands
UNDERSTANDING SECURITY CONCEPTS
General System Security
User Security Profile
Restricting User Activities
Object Security Profile
Using Passwords to Maintain System Security

TARGET AUDIENCE

Technical support staff with little or no experience in managing OpenVMS systems that may be part of larger networks and/or OpenVMS Clusters. 

COURSE OBJECTIVES

Upon completion of this course, students should be able to:
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Describe major system resources and their function in an OpenVMS environment.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	List the components of a DECnet network.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Create and use queues, including forms definition and management.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Define and manage LAT services.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Manage disk and tape volumes.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Describe the functions of the system startup and login files.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Set system parameters using AUTOGEN and SYSMAN.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Install OpenVMS layered products and updates.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Monitor system resources.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Perform tasks that enhance system security.

PREREQUISITES

Before taking this course, students should be able to:
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Manage system users, which requires:
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Maintaining the user authorization file and volume quota files.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Creating user file directories (UFDs).
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Controlling user processes.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Manage system resources, which requires:
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Mounting and dismounting disk and tape volumes.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Setting device characteristics.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Starting and stopping print and batch queues.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Performing full and incremental backups and restores of disk volumes.
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Starting up and shutting down a system using the default startup procedure.
These requirements can be met by completing OpenVMS System and Network Node Management I.

Projection unit for use with laptop

Each Student:

Hardware:

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	64+MB of memory
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	2 disks (2+GB)
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢	Networked and/or clustered

Software:
